Welcome to Tree’s documentation!¶

class tree.Tree[source]¶

Instances of this class are rooted trees with labels on the edges and values at the leaf nodes.

An example of such a tree is a directory structure, where the labels are the names of the files and directories, and the values are the contents of the files.

__setitem__(path, value)[source]¶

Set the value for the leaf at the end of specified path.

Parameters:
  • path – A single path segment, or a list of path segments at which to replace or set the value.
  • value – The value at the leaf at the end of path.
Returns:

None
__getitem__(path)[source]¶

Get the value or the subtree at the node where the path ends.

Parameters:path – A single path segment, or a list of path segments.
Returns:Either a tree, or a value at the leaf, depending on where the path ends.
static from_items()[source]¶

Create a tree from a sequence of (path, value) pairs.

Parameters:items – A sequence of (path, value) pairs.
Returns:A tree.
Return type:Tree
items(prefix=None)[source]¶

Return iterator over the (path, value) pairs in the tree, where path is a path from the root to a leaf, and value is the value at that leaf.

Parameters:prefix – List that gets prepended to every path. Use None for the empty list.
Return type:An iterator.
paths(prefix=None)[source]¶

Return iterator over the maximal paths (from root to leaf) in the tree.

Parameters:prefix – List that gets prepended to every path. Use None for the empty list.
Return type:An iterator.
values()[source]¶

Return iterator over the values at the leaves of the tree.

Return type:An iterator.
